lexUnit.name: purse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to the lips) pucker or contract.

sentence.text: Werewolf narrowed his eyes and pursed his lips at her , making a face which would have worried an exorcist .
Signe pursed her lips at me .
Cal pursed her mouth at me .
I shrugged and Gloria pursed her mouth in a self-satisfied smirk .
Merry pursed her lips in a silent whistle .
` And is there , " the Substitute pursed his lips in a smile and drew on his cigar , ` a brother in the case ? "
The French boy pursed his lips suddenly in an expression of disgust .
The Doctor pursed his lips in thought .
He halted only for a second , enough to narrow his eyes and purse his lips into a look of utter disgust , as though a dog 's turd had grown legs and scurried on to his carpet .
Mrs Friar pursed her lips into their accustomed position .
Morgan pursed his lips with distaste .
Swod pursed his lips with faint irascibility : his ` bon mot " about Mills had not been as conclusive as he hoped .
Dexter pursed his lips with disbelief and turned to Blanche , who was examining her fingernails thoughtfully .
Margaret pursed her bright orange lips .
Rostov pursed his lips .
Henry pursed his lips .
Jonas frowned and pursed his lips .
Von Steinholz pursed his lips angrily .
He pursed his lips thoughtfully and the hidden laughter in his eyes warned her that she might not like his answer .
She pursed her lips determinedly .
The lady in green pursed up her lips .
Isabel Lavender pursed up her mouth .
Samantha was pursing , licking and biting her lips .
